commits.subject: Merge pull request #19 from illuminAI-select/claude/restore-autoscroll-visualization-24ETg
commits.body: Restore auto-scroll to visualization after fixing freeze issue

commits.subject: Restore auto-scroll to visualization after fixing freeze issue
commits.body:
The page freeze when clicking "Update Visualization" was caused by CSS
transitions on 10,000 squares (fixed in commit cfd34da), not by the
scrollIntoView call that was removed in commit 55a33c8.

Now that the actual performance issue is resolved, we can safely restore
the auto-scroll functionality for better UX. When users click "Update
Visualization" (especially from the sidebar button), the page smoothly
scrolls to show the visualization at the top.

Changes:
- Restore scrollIntoView call in reshuffle() function (app.js:424-428)
- Update claude.md documentation to note auto-scroll feature
- No performance impact since CSS transitions remain removed

commits.subject: Merge pull request #18 from illuminAI-select/claude/fix-visualization-freeze-ZHt5T
commits.body: Fix visualization freeze by removing CSS transition

commits.subject: Fix visualization freeze by removing CSS transition
commits.body:
The page was freezing when clicking "Update Visualization" buttons due to
CSS transitions on 10,000 squares being animated simultaneously. This
overwhelmed the browser's rendering engine.

Changes:
- Remove transition from .square class in styles.css (line 521)
- Update claude.md to document the performance issue
- Remove outdated animation improvement suggestion from docs

The visualization now updates instantly without freezing, providing better
UX as users can see the new distribution immediately rather than waiting
for a 0.4s fade animation.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #17 from illuminAI-select/claude/fix-button-placement-performance-g4BRt
commits.body: Fix button placement and performance issues

commits.subject: Fix button placement and performance issues
commits.body:
- Move "Update Visualization" button below the image as a standalone element instead of overlaying it
- Remove absolute positioning and update CSS for better visual hierarchy
- Fix page freeze on visualization update by removing scrollIntoView call
- Optimize DOM manipulation using classList.toggle instead of building separate arrays
- Update help documentation to reflect UI changes and improved performance
- Add responsive styling for the new button placement

Performance improvements:
- Removed automatic scrolling that competed with DOM updates
- Simplified class toggling logic reducing operations from 3 loops to 1
- Eliminates janky behavior when clicking Update Visualization

commits.subject: Merge pull request #16 from illuminAI-select/claude/add-visualization-button-UpVtJ
commits.body: Add update visualization button below image

commits.subject: Add update visualization button below image
commits.body: Added a centered "Update Visualization" button positioned at the bottom of the visualization container. The button features the app's signature purple gradient styling and is fully responsive across all device sizes.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #15 from illuminAI-select/claude/reorganize-help-ui-4Ntg0
commits.body: Reorganize help UI and improve channel interaction

commits.subject: Reorganize help UI and improve channel interaction
commits.body:
- Move help button from main content area to top of sidebar
- Improve help button styling with gradient background and better alignment
- Fix help modal closing behavior with proper event handling
- Make inactive channels collapsed by default on initial load
- Auto-expand channels when activated, auto-collapse when deactivated
- Enhance visual appeal with improved spacing and transitions

commits.subject: Merge pull request #14 from illuminAI-select/claude/add-help-documentation-B6aGi
commits.body: Add comprehensive help documentation with modal

commits.subject: Add comprehensive help documentation with modal
commits.body:
Implemented an interactive help modal to guide users through the application:
- Added help button with icon in the main header
- Created detailed modal with sections covering:
  * What is Chatty Chart and visualization explanation
  * Getting started guide with step-by-step instructions
  * Channel controls documentation
  * Quick actions reference
  * Important notes and constraints
  * Use cases for the tool
- Styled modal with responsive design and smooth animations
- Implemented JavaScript handlers for open/close interactions
- Added keyboard support (ESC to close) and click-outside-to-close
- Ensured accessibility with ARIA labels and semantic HTML
- Mobile-optimized layout with proper responsive breakpoints

This addresses the need for in-app help to explain what the tool does and how to use it effectively.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #13 from illuminAI-select/claude/collapsible-sections-volume-split-Zf22c
commits.body: Add collapsible sections and automatic volume splitting

commits.subject: Add collapsible sections and automatic volume splitting
commits.body:
Implemented the following features:
- Collapsible channel sections with toggle button
- Initial load shows only 'calls' channel active at 100% volume
- Automatic volume splitting between unlocked and active channels
- Volume splitting triggers on both lock events and active status changes

The automatic volume splitting ensures percentages always add up to 100%
by distributing available percentage equally among unlocked, active channels.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #12 from illuminAI-select/claude/fix-visualization-reveal-OCfEd
commits.body: Fix visualization reveal logic - invert covered/visible behavior

commits.subject: Fix visualization reveal logic - invert covered/visible behavior
commits.body: The visualization was backwards: squares that should be visible (analyzed) were being covered instead. Fixed by inverting the logic so that 'analyzed' squares are revealed (not covered) and the remaining squares are covered (hidden).

commits.subject: Merge pull request #11 from illuminAI-select/claude/reorganize-visualization-layout-MtOZT
commits.body: Reorganize layout: swap columns, reverse overlay, add auto-scroll

commits.subject: Reorganize layout: swap columns, reverse overlay, add auto-scroll
commits.body:
- Swap visualization and input columns so visualization appears first (left on desktop)
- Remove initial black overlay - visualization now starts fully visible
- Reverse overlay behavior - analyzed data now covers the image instead of revealing it
- Add auto-scroll to top when visualization updates for better UX
- Rename CSS class from 'transparent' to 'covered' to reflect new behavior

commits.subject: Merge pull request #10 from illuminAI-select/claude/analyze-project-purpose-jJRDX
commits.body: Analyze project purpose and use case

commits.subject: Update messaging to emphasize sales/education purpose
commits.body:
Transform project messaging to focus on client education about missing
analytics opportunities, especially in audio/call channels.

Key changes:
- Reposition as sales tool showing hidden value in unanalyzed data
- Add "The Problem" section highlighting 95% of call data is invisible
- Update all UI labels to be client-focused and business-oriented
- Include use cases for sales presentations and ROI demonstrations
- Add guide for using tool in client meetings

commits.body: Replace current image with new one

commits.subject: Replace customer service image with analytics iceberg visualization
commits.body:
- Add analytics-iceberg.png showing communication channels and data analytics
- Remove old FinServ customer service image
- Update image reference in index.html
- Update README.md to reflect new image name

commits.subject: Merge pull request #8 from illuminAI-select/claude/optimize-mobile-visibility-fa2yZ
commits.body: Optimize mobile performance for visibility preset updates

commits.subject: Optimize mobile performance for visibility preset updates
commits.body:
Performance improvements:
- Replace Set-based random selection with efficient Fisher-Yates shuffle
- Add debouncing (300ms) to prevent rapid successive updates
- Batch DOM updates using requestAnimationFrame for smoother rendering
- Only modify squares that need class changes (avoid unnecessary reflows)
- Add loading state to prevent simultaneous update conflicts
- Auto-trigger visualization update after preset selection

These optimizations significantly reduce resource usage on mobile devices
when using quick visibility presets.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #7 from illuminAI-select/claude/improve-input-ux-k5fvi
commits.body: Improve input UX with clearer wording and mobile-friendly controls

commits.subject: Improve input UX with clearer wording and mobile-friendly controls
commits.body:
- Replace technical jargon with user-friendly labels
  - "Communication Channel Inputs" â†’ "Adjust Your Channels"
  - "Analyzed %" â†’ "Visibility"
  - "Enabled" â†’ "Active"
  - "Reshuffle" â†’ "Update Visualization"
  - "Distribute Remaining %" â†’ "Auto-Balance Channels"

- Add helpful contextual descriptions throughout the UI
  - Main help text explaining what the tool does
  - Section explanations for preset buttons
  - Inline help text for each control ("% of total data", "How much you can see")

- Improve mobile touch interaction
  - Add +/- stepper buttons for easier value adjustment on mobile
  - Replace cramped sliders with touch-friendly number inputs
  - Keep sliders visible on desktop only
  - Larger touch targets (44x44px minimum)

- Enhance visual hierarchy and layout
  - Better structured control rows with clear labels
  - Lock icon (ðŸ”’) instead of checkbox for locking channels
  - Separated sections with descriptive headings
  - Improved spacing and typography

This makes the interface intuitive for users without context while maintaining all functionality.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #6 from illuminAI-select/claude/mobile-responsive-restructure-OTCPC
commits.body: Restructure project with mobile-first responsive design

commits.subject: Restructure project with mobile-first responsive design
commits.body:
- Implemented industry-standard project structure with assets folders
- Separated concerns: external CSS and JavaScript files
- Enhanced mobile responsiveness with mobile-first approach
- Added proper touch targets (44px minimum) for mobile devices
- Improved responsive breakpoints: 480px, 768px, 1024px, 1280px
- Optimized layout to stack on mobile, side-by-side on desktop
- Added semantic HTML5 elements and accessibility attributes
- Updated README with project structure and features documentation

The index.html remains in root for GitHub Pages compatibility.
